intro: Euphrasia stricta subsp. tatarica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along streambanks. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces numerous small flowers clustered in the axils of the leaves. The species is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
